meanings.definition: Having a foolish or empty-headed demeanor.
meanings.sent1: The bubbleheaded clown made everyone laugh with his silly antics.
meanings.sent2: She always felt a bit bubbleheaded after staying up too late.
meanings.sent3: The bubbleheaded puppy chased its tail in circles, amusing everyone around.
meanings.sent4: Her bubbleheaded behavior at the party was like a colorful balloon floating in the air.
meanings.sent5: The bubbleheaded character in the movie was so unforgettable, like a bright bubble in a sea of gray.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a lack of intelligence or common sense.
meanings.sent1: The bubbleheaded student forgot his homework for the third time this week.
meanings.sent2: His bubbleheaded decision to drive without a map got them lost in the unfamiliar city.
meanings.sent3: The bubbleheaded idea of wearing flip-flops in the snow made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her bubbleheaded mistake was like a neon sign flashing 'oops' in big letters.
meanings.sent5: The bubbleheaded error in the report stood out like a bright red flag waving in the wind.
